IP_PART25_3_syn_1:
Dx: Malignant pleural effusion (R).
Proc: US-guided PleurX placement.
Drainage: 1.55 L.
Complications: None.
IP_PART25_3_syn_2: The patient with stage IV NSCLC and recurrent malignant pleural effusion underwent ultrasound-guided placement of a tunneled indwelling pleural catheter (PleurX). The procedure yielded 1.55 liters of fluid and was tolerated well.
IP_PART25_3_syn_3: Code 32550: Insertion of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff. Imaging guidance (US) utilized. 1.55 L fluid drained.
IP_PART25_3_syn_4:
Procedure:
1. US localization.
2. Local anesthetic.
3. Tunnel created.
4. Catheter inserted into pleural space.
5. 1.55 L drained.
6. Dressing applied.
IP_PART25_3_syn_5: put in a pleurx catheter today right side lung cancer patient lots of fluid used ultrasound to find the spot tunneled it in drained about 1.55 liters patient feels better.
IP_PART25_3_syn_6: Ultrasound-guided tunneled PleurX catheter placement was performed for a recurrent right malignant pleural effusion in a stage IV NSCLC patient. 1.55 L was drained.
IP_PART25_3_syn_7:
[Indication]
Recurrent malignant effusion.
[Anesthesia]
Local.
[Description]
US-guided PleurX placement right side. 1.55 L drained.
[Plan]
Home nursing setup.
IP_PART25_3_syn_8: We performed an ultrasound-guided placement of a tunneled PleurX catheter for the patient's recurrent right malignant pleural effusion due to stage IV NSCLC. We successfully drained 1.55 L of fluid.
IP_PART25_3_syn_9: Tunneled PleurX catheter insertion was guided by ultrasound for symptomatic recurrent right malignant pleural effusion. 1.55 L of fluid was evacuated.
